reviewText:
This game is really a gem. While it is an indie game and mobile port, it really doesn't feel like it. The game interface and core mechanics are very solid and feel complete. The core gameplay is a bit typical, but there is a good balance of well set up senarios, large degrees of player freedom, and reasonable depth. Seeing turnbased gameplay really turns me off, but it manages to be simple enough to be accessable, while complicated and intense enough to be interesting. The art and music is also great in my opinion and very reminicent of 2007 Runescape. The multiplayer is dead, but there is a random senario generator to extend the life of the game past the campaign.

Pros
-Large amount of monsters/spells/stat upgrades
-Well set up levels/puzzles
-Variety of level approaches
-Crafting system
-Random senario generator
-Great art
-No bugs/glitches
Cons
-Dead Multiplayer
-Occasional redundant/irelevant enemy descovered"

While I did get this in a bundle
date: I would recommend buying on sale or full price."

reviewText:
Three battles in and I'm hooked! Sure, it might have relied on voxel-style visuals, but the gameplay is solid so far. It doesn't look like the strategy and tactics will get very deep, but if you're craving a tactical RPG, give it a go!

- I got this as part of a bundle -

Edit - And I've finished the main campaign at about 18 hours. Hotseat and Online Multiplayer are included, but I have yet to try either.

reviewText: This game is highly addictive. I was drawn in by the voxel world & the idea of turn based battles revolving around summoning creatures and I was blown away. I loved the different summons I was able to invest in and how I can level up my warlock. The spells are so usefull, I always saved up enough mana to cast one just in case. I had to replay several levels just to try to find some of the hidden gems and I have yet to find them all. If you enjoy turn based tactics and strategy, this is a solid addtion to add, especially for the price.\n\n9/10 A great tactical game with tons of replayability.

reviewText:
-- Für die Deutsche Version bitte nach unten Scrollen, danke.

This game is just fantastic. You can really feel how much love went into this. It is a mix up of different genres, working out together in an absolutly brilliant way. I already had bought the game on iPad and decided to aquire it again on PC. The PC-version is even better, as the controls with mouse an keybord is easier.

The Game is turn-based and about defeating the opponent's Warlock. Each warlock can cast spells, which either work directy (fireball") or summon creatures that fight for you. Each creature has it's own characteristics
date: strengh and weaknesses. There are chests with power-ups to discover
hoursPlayed: weapons to use and items to craft. The envoirment ist distructable and can be included in your strategy. You gain items to "level-up" different characteristics

reviewText: A Rose Among Thorns!\n\nIt's a genuine pleasure to write a great review for a company who cares. I am a huge RPG fan and, over the years, I've looked at hundreds (and tried dozens) of turned-based RPGs. The Last Warlock represents hours of research on my part. So far, I consider it the best turn-based RPG-battle game I own and I've been playing the Android version since its release. The depth, attention to detail, ease of use, and enjoyment, make this game a true rose among thorns. This game has my full endorsement. Get it and you'll understand how strategy games are supposed to be written, but be prepared, you have to use your brain and cannot rely on finger dexterity (that's why I love turn-based solutions).
voteText: 18 of 35 people (51%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Do you love unoriginal, unfinished, and agonizingly slow-paced strategy games? Me neither.

Visuals style and sounds effects taken from straight from Minecraft. There is sooo much royalty free music from the moment you open the game to the victory sound. It makes the game sound and therefore feel unprofessional, unpolished and just thrown together. The audio can make or break a game. Furthermore, using Minecraft’s visual style makes the game seem even less developed. It’s just pandering. Instead of being creative or trying to create any sort of original style you put yourself in a position where you can’t succeed because people know how to spot knock-offs.

I don’t need to play anymore of this game to know I am not going to enjoy it, at all. In fact I regret even opening this game as now my average achievement score, which I work pretty hard, is lower.

I got this games as a part of a bundle and that is the only reason it’s in my inventory, there is no way I would’ve convinced myself to get this game. So many of its short comings are apparent from just the trailers that are available on the Steam store.

Go play any other top-down, turn-based strategy game, please.

reviewText: Has a nice minecraftian feel to it. The visuals and effects can always be upgraded down the road. The game mechanics are fun and suprisingly indepth. Have logged almost 9 hrs on it so far in just campaign mode. No glitchs or errors to speak of. I'm enjoying leveling up my guy to cast new creatures and spells. I paid $7.99 for it, you can't beat that deal. I can see alot of potential for growth in this game if the players show up to support it.
